function.description:
Connect to an Oracle database. Returns a connection object.
The host parameter is the name of the host. The default port is 1521 but can be set to a different port is necessary. The database parameter is the name of the database you want to connect to. The user and pass parameter are for the username and password. Both are optional. The options parameter is optional. It is used to set Oracle specific options. These can be found here:
http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E13222_01/wls/docs92/jdbc_drivers/oracle.html#wp1066413

example.header: Connect to the Oracle database "testdb" with user "user" and password "pass".
